3.37 
Grounds and procedure for the annulment of a marriage 
1. A marriage may be annulled if the conditions for the celebration of the marriage laid down in Articles 3.12 to 3.17 of this Code have been violated, on the grounds laid down in Articles 3.39 and 3.40 of this Code, or if one of the persons wishing to marry has failed to notify the other that he/she is suffering from a sexually transmitted disease or from AIDS. 
2. A marriage shall be annulled only by a court. 
3. A marriage shall be declared null and void from the moment of its conclusion. 
4. The court must send the annulment decision by electronic means to the civil registry office that registered the marriage no later than the working day following the date on which the annulment becomes final.
